This is just a regular, run-of-the-mill Chicken. It's been quite a while since they were last seen alive, and the passing of time has not been kind; for the Chicken forgot how to bear and lay the Egg. For better or worse, this event is not as tragic as it is annoying.
Lay Item: Feathers!
Shown above: a regular Chicken. Flip the page to check out the Chicken Catcher.

You will need one of these to manage your chickens and use them in crafting! Simply look at a chicken and use the Catcher on it. ''Itemized'' chickens can be stacked, put into Roosts, or let back into the world to roam as usual.
A Roost can be used to contain a Chicken (or even a number of Chickens) in a single block-space, and passively collect their main Lay Item without unwanted clutter.
Chicken Breeders let your Chickens have some quality private time behind closed curtains for as long as the Breeder is stocked with Seeds, and has space for more... descendants.

Just in case you want to let some Chickens run around unsupervised, a Henhouse allows one to collect the main Lay Items of Chickens in a 9x9x9 radius around the Henhouse; however, it must be supplied with Hay Bale in order to function.

When you've amassed walls upon walls of Roosts, extracting the produce from them can get somewhat awkward. The Collector lets you forgo resource-heavy pipe and hopper setups by extracting materials from Roosts within a certain range around it.
